summary:
• Scooter Braun retires from music management after 23 years.
• Researchers discover the ship where Ernest Shackleton died in Canada.
• A famous musician's manager has retired after 23 years. 
• Canadian researchers have found a historic ship that was involved in an important event.

• China is reportedly planning to significantly expand its nuclear arsenal.
• This move comes amid rising tensions with other nations in the region.
• The expansion could lead to increased instability in the Asia-Pacific area.

• Russia sends warships to Cuba amid growing tensions with US
• Ships arrive in Havana as part of joint naval exercise between countries
• Presence seen as challenge to US dominance in Caribbean region

• Torrential rains cause widespread destruction and loss of life due to deadly landslides in Ecuador
• Heavy rainfall leads to devastating consequences across the country
• Authorities work tirelessly to rescue those trapped under debris and provide aid to affected communities

• Kylian Mbappé urges young people to vote against extremists.
• Jordan Bardella may become Prime Minister of France at 28 years old.
• The city of Paris rehearsed its Olympic opening ceremony in preparation for the games.

• A man was shot by police while carrying an axe in Hamburg.
• The incident sparked alarm among residents, raising concerns about public safety.
• Police responded promptly to neutralize the threat, but details of the motive remain unclear.

• The Greek opposition demands an investigation into reports of migrant deaths, citing concerns over humanitarian treatment.
• They urge action to prevent similar incidents in the future.
• The opposition's call comes amid growing scrutiny of Greece's handling of migration policies.

• India's Booker Prize-winning author may be jailed for an offensive remark made in 2008.
• The author faces up to two years in prison under the National Security Act.
• Prime Minister Narendra Modi is facing criticism over his handling of the COVID-19 crisis.

• Iraqi militias protest against US involvement in Gaza conflict by targeting American businesses
• Militias attack KFC and other US companies to express their discontent with US role in Gaza conflict
• Protests escalate as militia groups target US-owned businesses in response to Gaza situation

• Netanyahu dissolves war cabinet due to key departures.
• Key Democrats approve major arms sale to Israel, including F-15s.
• Eight Israeli soldiers die in Rafah amid preparations for somber Eid holiday.

• Islamist insurgency spreads in Mozambique
• Insurgents threaten to kill civilians
• Violence escalates across the country

• Extreme heat causes dehydration issues in crowded prisons.
• Heatwave affects Philippine cities, making daily life challenging.
• Scorching temperatures threaten public health due to overcrowding in prisons.

• Muslims worldwide mark Eid al-Adha with festivities.
• Severe heat in Mecca claims lives during Hajj pilgrimage.
• Temperature records broken at Mecca's hottest spot.

• A massive oil spill has left Singapore's popular beaches covered in blackened oil slicks.
• The environmental disaster threatens to harm marine life and disrupt tourist activities.
• Cleanup efforts are underway to mitigate the damage and restore affected areas.

• Zuma's MK party will join South Africa's opposition alliance.
• The move is expected to strengthen the opposition against President Ramaphosa's ruling ANC party.
• This development comes after years of political instability in South Africa.

• Ukraine's conscription squads are forcing Ukrainian men to hide, evading military service.
• Despite being away from war, some Ukrainian soccer players are willing to participate in combat.
• Due to insufficient troop numbers, Ukraine is releasing prisoners to take up arms.

• Rod Stewart defended his support for Ukraine amidst jeers.
• Princess Kate attended the king's parade, her first public event since cancer news.
• The Queen hosted a reception for Ukrainian refugees at Windsor Castle.

• Maryland pardons 175,000 people with cannabis-related convictions.
• A US pastor gets 9-year sentence for financial crimes.
• The President waives penalties for some immigrants who entered the country illegally as spouses of American citizens.
